com.mixer.interactive

Class GameClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mixer.interactive.GameClient

  • public class GameClient
extends Object

    A GameClient is used to connect to a Interactive integration that is hosted on the Interactive service. A client can only connect to the integration that was specified when the client was created.

    Once connected a client has the ability to query information on the integration from the Interactive service, as well as manipulate resources in the integration by making requests to the Interactive service.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Microsoft Corporation

      • ready

        public void ready(boolean isReady)

        Notifies the Interactive service whether or not this client is ready to have clients connect and start interacting.

        The parameters of the request (isReady: true or isReady: false) determine whether or not the Interactive integration this client is connected to is ready to have clients connect and start interacting or not, respectively.

        Parameters:
        isReady - The value to pass along in the ready method call
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setCompression

        public CompressionScheme setCompression(CompressionScheme... schemes)
                                 throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                                        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException

        Changes the compression algorithm the client uses to encode/decode messages to/from the Interactive service.

        Developers supply a collection of preferred schemes in order of preference, from greatest to least preference, from which the Interactive service will select a preferred common one. All subsequent requests and replies will be sent in using the new compression scheme.

        If no preferred common scheme is found, the Interactive server will fall back to the plain text scheme.

        Parameters:
        schemes - An array of preferred CompressionSchemes in order of preference, from greatest to least preference
        Returns:
        The new CompressionScheme that the client is to use to communicate with the Interactive service
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        CompressionScheme

      • setCompression

        public CompressionScheme setCompression(Collection<String> schemes)
                                 throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                                        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException

        Changes the compression algorithm the client uses to encode/decode messages to/from the Interactive service.

        Developers supply a collection of preferred schemes in order of preference, from greatest to least preference, from which the Interactive service will select a preferred common one. All subsequent requests and replies will be sent in using the new compression scheme.

        If no preferred common scheme is found, the Interactive server will fall back to the plain text scheme.

        Parameters:
        schemes - An Collection of preferred CompressionSchemes in order of preference, from greatest to least preference
        Returns:
        The new CompressionScheme that the client is to use to communicate with the Interactive service
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:

      • getTime

        public Long getTime()
             throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                    InteractiveRequestNoReplyException
        Retrieves the current server time from the Interactive service, given as a milliseconds UTC unix timestamp.
        Returns:
        The Interactive service's current server time, given as a UTC unix timestamp (in milliseconds)
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getTimeAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Long> getTimeAsync()

        Retrieves the current server time from the Interactive service, given as a milliseconds UTC unix timestamp.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns the Interactive service's current server time, given as a UTC unix timestamp (in milliseconds)
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getMemoryStats

        public InteractiveMemoryStatistic getMemoryStats()
                                          throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                                                 InteractiveRequestNoReplyException

        Retrieves the current memory usage for the Interactive integration this client is connected to on the Interactive service. The memory usage returned is a dump of information regarding current memory allocations, as well as a breakdown of how much memory is allocated where. This information is provided for debugging purposes.

        Returns:
        A InteractiveMemoryStatistic representing the current memory usage of the Interactive integration the client is connected to
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveMemoryStatistic

      • getMemoryStatsAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<InteractiveMemoryStatistic> getMemoryStatsAsync()

        Retrieves the current memory usage for the Interactive integration this client is connected to on the Interactive service. The memory usage returned is a dump of information regarding current memory allocations, as well as a breakdown of how much memory is allocated where. This information is provided for debugging purposes.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns a InteractiveMemoryStatistic representing the current memory usage of the Interactive integration the client is connected to
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveMemoryStatistic

      • getThrottleState

        public Map<InteractiveMethod,ThrottleState> getThrottleState()
                                                      throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                                                             InteractiveRequestNoReplyException
        Retrieves statistics on the state of throttling rules set up in InteractiveMethod.SET_BANDWIDTH_THROTTLE method requests. It returns the number of sent packets (ones inserted into the bucket) and the number of rejected packets for each method that has a throttle set.
        Returns:
        A Map of InteractiveMethods and their associated ThrottleState
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        BandwidthThrottle, InteractiveMethod, ThrottleState

      • getThrottleStateAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Map<InteractiveMethod,ThrottleState>> getThrottleStateAsync()

        Retrieves statistics on the state of throttling rules set up in InteractiveMethod.SET_BANDWIDTH_THROTTLE method requests. It returns the number of sent packets (ones inserted into the bucket) and the number of rejected packets for each method that has a throttle set.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns a Map of InteractiveMethods and their associated ThrottleState
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        BandwidthThrottle, InteractiveMethod, ThrottleState

      • setBandwidthThrottle

        public void setBandwidthThrottle(Map<InteractiveMethod,BandwidthThrottle> throttleMap)
                          throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                                 InteractiveRequestNoReplyException

        Sets up throttling for certain server-to-client method calls, such as InteractiveMethod.GIVE_INPUT, which could become problematic in very high-traffic scenarios.

        The Interactive service implements a leaky bucket algorithm; the client specifies the total bucket capacity in bytes and its drain rate in bytes per second. The client supplies a map of method names and their associated throttle rules. Throttling previously enabled on a method can be disabled by setting it to null.

        Parameters:
        throttleMap - A Map of InteractiveMethods and their associated BandwidthThrottle
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        BandwidthThrottle, InteractiveMethod

      • setBandwidthThrottleAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Boolean> setBandwidthThrottleAsync(Map<InteractiveMethod,BandwidthThrottle> throttleMap)

        Sets up throttling for certain server-to-client method calls, such as InteractiveMethod.GIVE_INPUT, which could become problematic in very high-traffic scenarios.

        The Interactive service implements a leaky bucket algorithm; the client specifies the total bucket capacity in bytes and its drain rate in bytes per second. The client supplies a map of method names and their associated throttle rules. Throttling previously enabled on a method can be disabled by setting it to null.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Parameters:
        throttleMap - A Map of InteractiveMethods and their associated BandwidthThrottle
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns true if the setBandwidthThrottle method call completes with no errors
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        BandwidthThrottle, InteractiveMethod
